Name:
USS Yarnall
HMS Lincoln
HNoMS Lincoln
Druzhny (Friendly)
Fate:
Transferred to UK, 23 October 1940
Transferred to USSR as a parts hulk, 26 August 1944; returned by Soviet Union August 1952 and sold for scrap
Returned to United Kingdom, 25 December 1943
Returned to United Kingdom for scrapping, 23 August 1952
Notes:
Transferred to Norway February 1942
loaned to Canada July 1942; returned to United Kingdom 25 December 1943
May have been in active Soviet Navy service, 23 September 1944 to end of World War II
Acquired:
February 1942
26 August 1944 used as a parts hulk
Armament:
4 × 4"/50 caliber guns,
2 × 3 in (76 mm)/23 guns,
12 × 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes,
2 × .30 cal (7.62 mm) machine guns,
2 × depth charge racks
